page.title: 19TYPES OF HOUSES IN SLOUGH
page.content: The housing of this area falls into three distinct bands. To the extreme west is the earliest housing built in the late 1920s by the owners of the Slough Trading Estate; these three bedroomed houses are wholly privately owned. The next band contains two areas. To the north is the Manor Park Estate built for the borough council fifty years ago for the many people who came to Slough from 'depressed' areas of Britain, especially South Wales. These 'non-parlour' houses with downstairs toilets are now partly privately owned and partly council owned. To the south are medium-sized privately owned properties built less than fifty years ago. In between this housing and the final band is open space, some arable land, a cemetery & crematorium, several schools and the remains of a country estate.
